articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Alasdair Pal
articles.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese's centre-left Labor Party was projected to win over the conservative opposition, Sky News Australia and the Australian Broadcasting Corporation said as early vote counting showed Labor in a strong position.
articles.title: Labor wins Australia election, broadcasters ABC, Sky News Australia say

articles.author: David Lewis, Giulia Paravicini, Sonia Rolley
articles.description: The M23 insurgents who routed Congo’s army to take control of the eastern part of one of Africa’s most populous nations now face a task as mundane as it is daunting: governing.
articles.title: In Congo, M23 rebels’ latest fight is to revive the economy

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Max Hunder
articles.description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy said that he and Trump agreed that a 30-day ceasefire between Kyiv and Moscow was the correct first step toward peace.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says he discussed air defence, sanctions with Trump in Vatican meeting

articles.author: Xinghui Kok, Jun Yong
articles.description: Singaporeans were voting in an election on Saturday almost certain to perpetuate the unbroken rule of the People's Action Party, in a test of public approval for the new prime minister as the city-state braces for economic turbulence from a global trade war.
articles.title: Singapore votes in test of ruling party's monopoly

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's conservative People Power Party picked former labour minister Kim Moon-soo as its candidate for the June 3 presidential election, which was called after the removal of Yoon Suk Yeol over his failed martial law attempt.
articles.title: South Korea's conservative party picks Kim Moon-soo as presidential candidate

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: President Donald Trump posted an AI-generated photo showing himself as the pope ahead of this week's gathering of cardinals to choose a new leader of the 1.4-billion-strong Catholic Church, and just days after he joked he would "like to be pope".
articles.title: Trump posts AI-generated photo of himself as pope

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sirri Sureyya Onder, a prominent pro-Kurdish party lawmaker and key figure in Turkey's tentative process to end the outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party's (PKK) insurgency, died on Saturday at age 62, his party said.
articles.title: Pro-Kurdish MP and key peace negotiator Onder dies at 62

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Saturday it wanted what it called a "definitive" response from Ukraine to Russian President Vladimir Putin's offer of a three-day ceasefire to coincide with World War Two victory commemorations this month.
articles.title: Kremlin says it wants a definitive Ukrainian response to Putin's offer of a three-day ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazil's former President Jair Bolsonaro is expected to be discharged from the hospital "in the coming days" following major abdominal surgery last month to treat an intestinal obstruction, his medical team said on Saturday.
articles.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro expected to be discharged from hospital in coming days

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: India said it has banned the import of goods originating from or transiting via Pakistan as diplomatic tensions between the two nuclear-armed nations flared in the wake of a deadly attack on tourists in disputed Kashmir region.
articles.title: India bans imports from Pakistan amid tension over tourist killings
